required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate the Clinical Efficacy and Safety of Subcutaneously Administered C1 Esterase Inhibitor for the Prevention of Angioedema Attacks in Adolescents and Adults With Hereditary Angioedema
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Two-period, Three-sequence, Partial Crossover Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Subcutaneous Administration of 2000 IU of C1 Esterase Inhibitor [Human] Liquid for Injection for the Prevention of Angioedema Attacks in Adolescents and Adults With Hereditary Angioedema

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the efficacy and safety of subcutaneous administration of a liquid formulation of C1 esterase inhibitor for the prevention of angioedema attacks in adolescent and adult subjects with hereditary angioedema.

primary_outcome.measure: Time-Normalized Number of Attacks (NNA) for Participants During a Treatment Period
primary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 1 to 14 for treatment period 1 and 2
primary_outcome.description: The angioedema attacks were recorded in the electronic patient diary. The investigator completed a separate angioedema eCRF for each attack based on the review of the patients diary. Time-normalized number of angioedema attacks was expressed as the number of attacks per month (ie, 30.4 days) of exposure. NNA=30.4 * (number of attacks during treatment period) / (days of treatment period).

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Meeting at Least a 50% Reduction in NNA (Normalized Number of Angioedema Attacks) During the Experimental Injection Treatment Period Relative to the Placebo Period.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 1 to 14 for treatment period 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: The angioedema attacks were recorded in the electronic patient diary. The investigator completed a separate angioedema eCRF for each attack based on the review of the patients diary. Time-Normalized Number of Attacks was expressed as the number of attacks per month (ie, 30.4 days) of exposure. NNA = 30.4 x (number of attacks during treatment period) / (days of treatment period).

secondary_outcome.measure: Time-Normalized Number of Attacks (NNA) for Participants During Each Treatment Period Excluding the First 2 Weeks.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 3 to 14 for treatment period 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: The angioedema attacks were recorded in the electronic patient diary. The investigator completed a separate angioedema eCRF for each attack based on the review of the patients diary. Time-normalized number of angioedema attacks was expressed as the number of attacks per month (ie, 30.4 days) of exposure. NNA=30.4 * (number of attacks during treatment period) / (days of treatment period).

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Meeting at Least a 50% Reduction in NNA (Normalized Number of Angioedema Attacks) During the Experimental Injection Treatment Period Relative to the Placebo Period Excluding the First 2 Weeks of Each Treatment Period.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 3 to 14 for treatment period 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: The angioedema attacks were recorded in the electronic patient diary. The investigator completed a separate angioedema eCRF for each attack based on the review of the patients diary. Time-Normalized Number of Attacks was expressed as the number of attacks per month (ie, 30.4 days) of exposure. NNA = 30.4 x (number of attacks during treatment period) / (days of treatment period).

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Meeting at Least a 50% Reduction in NNA (Normalized Number of Angioedema Attacks) During the Experimental Injection Treatment Period Relative to the Pre-treatment Assessment.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 1 to 14 for treatment period 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: The angioedema attacks were recorded in the electronic patient diary. The investigator completed a separate angioedema eCRF for each attack based on the review of the patients diary. Time-Normalized Number of Attacks was expressed as the number of attacks per month (ie, 30.4 days) of exposure. NNA = 30.4 x (number of attacks during treatment period) / (days of treatment period).

secondary_outcome.measure: Cumulative Attack Severity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 1 to 14 for treatment period 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Severity of the angioedema attack sign/symptom was characterized as None: no symptom; Mild: noticeable symptom but easily tolerated by the participant and did not interfere with routine activities; Moderate: symptom interfered with the participant's ability to attend school or participate in family life and social/recreational activities; Severe: symptom significantly limited the participant's ability to attend school or participate in family life and social/recreational activities. Symptom severity score was assigned as Mild = 1, Moderate = 2 and Severe = 3. Cumulative attack severity score was the sum of the maximum symptom severity scores recorded for each angioedema attack in a treatment period. Cumulative attack-severity score normalized per month [(raw score/number of days of participation in that treatment period)*30.4] was reported here. Cumulative attack-severity score normalized per month ranged from 0 to 19.83 and higher scores represent worse symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Attack-free Days
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 1 to 14 for treatment period 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Attack free days were normalized per month.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Angioedema Attacks Requiring Acute Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 1 to 14 for treatment period 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Angioedema attacks were normalized per month.

secondary_outcome.measure: Response to Icatibant When Administered for an Acute Attack
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 1 to 14 for treatment period 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: The number of Acute Hereditary Angioedema Attacks that required Icatibant as acute therapy is presented by the number of Icatibant injections.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 1 to 14 for treatment period 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAE) were counted by the treatment most recently taken when the event occurred. Participants were counted once per category per treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Injection Site Reactions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 1 to 14 for treatment period 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Injection site reactions (Erythema, Swelling, Cutaneous pain, Burning sensation, Itching/Pruritus, Warm sensation) were recorded on a designated eCRF page by the site personnel who monitored the local reaction for 1 hour after IP administration 5 times during each treatment period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Positive Anti-C1 INH Antibodies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 1 to 14 for treatment period 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-C1 INH antibodies were measured during study time.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK Parameters: AUC (0-96) and AUC (0-t) for Functional C1 INH Binding Activity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 15 min prior dosing at week 1, week 2, week 8, week 16, week 24, week 27/28 and 48 (± 3) hours after dose in week 27/28 in period 1 and 2. In addition 24 (±3) hours, 72 (±6) hours and 96 (±6) hours post dose in week 28 for period 2.
secondary_outcome.description: AUC(0-96)=area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero to last measurable concentration; AUC(0-t)=area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to the end of the dosing interval tau, where tau is approximately 84 hours (ie, average of every 3 or 4 days) AUC(0-96) = AUC(0-tau).

secondary_outcome.measure: PK Parameters: AUC (0-96) and AUC (0-t) for C1 INH Antigen Concentrations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 15 min prior dosing at week 1, week 2, week 8, week 16, week 24, week 27/28 and 48 (± 3) hours after dose in week 27/28 in period 1 and 2. In addition 24 (±3) hours, 72 (±6) hours and 96 (±6) hours post dose in week 28 for period 2.
secondary_outcome.description: AUC(0-96)=area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero to last measurable concentration; AUC(0-t)=area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to the end of the dosing interval tau, where tau is approximately 84 hours (ie, average of every 3 or 4 days) AUC(0-96) = AUC(0-tau).

secondary_outcome.measure: PK Parameters: AUC (0-96) and AUC (0-t) for Complement C4 Concentrations (Treamtment C1 INH)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 15 min prior dosing at week 1, week 2, week 8, week 16, week 24, week 27/28 and 48 (± 3) hours after dose in week 27/28 in period 1 and 2. In addition 24 (±3) hours, 72 (±6) hours and 96 (±6) hours post dose in week 28 for period 2.
secondary_outcome.description: AUC(0-96)=area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero to last measurable concentration; AUC(0-t)=area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to the end of the dosing interval tau, where tau is approximately 84 hours (ie, average of every 3 or 4 days) AUC(0-96) = AUC(0-tau).

secondary_outcome.measure: PK Parameters: AUC (0-96) and AUC (0-t) for Complement C4 Concentrations (Treatment Placebo)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 15 min prior dosing at week 1, week 2, week 8, week 16, week 24, week 27/28 and 48 (± 3) hours after dose in week 27/28 in period 1 and 2. In addition 24 (±3) hours, 72 (±6) hours and 96 (±6) hours post dose in week 28 for period 2.
secondary_outcome.description: AUC(0-96)=area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero to last measurable concentration; AUC(0-t)=area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to the end of the dosing interval tau, where tau is approximately 84 hours (ie, average of every 3 or 4 days) AUC(0-96) = AUC(0-tau). Participant wise data was reported for this outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK Parameters: Cmax and Cmin for Functional C1 INH Binding Activity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 15 min prior dosing at week 1, week 2, week 8, week 16, week 24, week 27/28 and 48 (± 3) hours after dose in week 27/28 in period 1 and 2 and in addition 24 (±3) hours, 72 (±6) hours and 96 (±6) hours post dose in week 28 for period 2.
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax=maximum observed plasma concentration and Cmin=minimum observed plasma concentration

secondary_outcome.measure: PK Parameters: Cmax and Cmin for C1 INH Antigen Concentrations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 15 min prior dosing at week 1, week 2, week 8, week 16, week 24, week 27/28 and 48 (± 3) hours after dose in week 27/28 in period 1 and 2 and in addition 24 (±3) hours, 72 (±6) hours and 96 (±6) hours post dose in week 28 for period 2
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax=maximum observed plasma concentration and Cmin=minimum observed plasma concentration

secondary_outcome.measure: PK Parameters: Cmax and Cmin for Complement C4 Concentrations (Treatment C1 INH)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 15 min prior dosing at week 1, week 2, week 8, week 16, week 24, week 27/28 and 48 (± 3) hours after dose in week 27/28 in period 1 and 2 and in addition 24 (±3) hours, 72 (±6) hours and 96 (±6) hours post dose in week 28 for period 2.
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax=maximum observed plasma concentration and Cmin=minimum observed plasma concentration

secondary_outcome.measure: PK Parameters: Cmax and Cmin for Complement C4 Concentrations (Treatment Placebo)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 15 min prior dosing at week 1, week 2, week 8, week 16, week 24, week 27/28 and 48 (± 3) hours after dose in week 27/28 in period 1 and 2 and in addition 24 (±3) hours, 72 (±6) hours and 96 (±6) hours post dose in week 28 for period 2.
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax=maximum observed plasma concentration and Cmin=minimum observed plasma concentration. Participant wise data was reported for this outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK Parameters: Tmax
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 15 min prior dosing at week 1, week 2, week 8, week 16, week 24, week 27/28 and 48 (± 3) hours after dose in week 27/28 in period 1 and 2 and in addition 24 (±3) hours, 72 (±6) hours and 96 (±6) hours post dose in week 28 for period 2.
secondary_outcome.description: tmax=time of maximum observed plasma concentration

secondary_outcome.measure: PK Parameters: Tmax for Complement C4 Concentrations (Placebo Group)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 15 min prior dosing at week 1, week 2, week 8, week 16, week 24, week 27/28 and 48 (± 3) hours after dose in week 27/28 in period 1 and 2 and in addition 24 (±3) hours, 72 (±6) hours and 96 (±6) hours post dose in week 28 for period 2.
secondary_outcome.description: tmax=time of maximum observed plasma concentration. Participant wise data was reported for this outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess Disease Activity as Measured by the Angioedema Activity Score (AAS) Normalized Per Month
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 1 to 14 for treatment period 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Disease activity was measured using a 98-day Angioedema Activity Score (AAS). The AAS collects information of disease activity in the last 24 hours. The following items are assessed: experience of swelling, severity of the swelling, timing of the swelling, extent of discomfort due to the swelling, extent that the swelling caused limitations in daily life, and feelings of being disfigured by the swelling. The instrument uses a binary response option for the first item and a three-point response scale for the 5 items thereafter. The daily AAS was the sum of the AAS items per day. Total daily ASS scores range between 0 and 15 points. Higher values stand for higher disease activity. The normalized 98-day AAS per month for a participant is calculated by (the sum of daily AAS within a treatment period/the number of days that a subject has AAS records within the treatment period)*30.4.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant Experience With Self-administration: Overall Experience With the Syringe
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 14 for treatment period 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Self-administration survey with questions about the overall experience with the syringe was assessed in week 14 (visit 28 and 28b). Visit 28 summarizes treatment period 1 of the experimental/experimental arm and treatment periods 1 and 2 of the experimental/placebo arm and the placebo/experimental arm. Visit 28b summarizes treatment period 2 of the experimental/experimental arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant Experience With Self-administration: How Many Visits for Confidence With Self-administration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 14 for treatment period 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: The self-administration survey includes the number of visits needed for participants to be able to self-administer investigational product with confidence and all participants could self-administer without supervision. Visit 28 summarizes treatment period 1 of the experimental/experimental arm and treatment periods 1 and 2 of the experimental/placebo arm and the placebo/experimental arm. Visit 28b summarizes treatment period 2 of the experimental/experimental arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant Experience With Self-administration: Better Long-term Option and Preferred Administration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 14 for treatment period 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: The self-administration survey includes the number of visits needed for participants to be able to self-administer investigational product with confidence and all participants could self-administer without supervision. Visit 28 summarizes treatment period 1 of the experimental/experimental arm and treatment periods 1 and 2 of the experimental/placebo arm and the placebo/experimental arm. Visit 28b summarizes treatment period 2 of the experimental/experimental arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change in Angioedema Quality of Life Questionnaire Scores From Baseline to Week 13
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to week 13 for treatment period 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: The AE-QoL is a questionnaire on the quality of life of patients suffering from recurrent angioedema. It consists of 17 specific questions that are associated with work, physical activity, free time, social relations, and food. Each of the 17 questions has a five-point response scale ranging from 1 (Never) to 5 (Very Often). The AE-QoL consists of 4 dimensions (functioning=4 questions(qns) fatigue/mood=5 qns, fears/shame=6 qns, nutrition=2 qns) and a total score (all 17 questions).All scores were calculated by using the following formula: (Σ items - min Σ items / max Σ items - min Σ items) x 100. Σ items=sum of response by participant, min Σ items=minimum response possible, max Σ items=maximum response possible. Scores range from 0 to 100 , with higher scores indicating greater impairment. Absolute change calculated as visit score at week 13 minus score at baseline per period.

arm_group.description: Subjects will be randomized to receive C1 Esterase Inhibitor in the 1st Treatment period and then switch to Placebo in the 2nd treatment period.
Subjects will be randomized to receive a placebo treatment in the 1st Treatment period and then switch to receive C1 Esterase Inhibitor in the 2nd treatment period.
Subjects will be randomized and receive C1 Esterase Inhibitor in both 1st as well as the 2nd treatment period

intervention.description: C1 Esterase Inhibitor [Human] Liquid administered Subcutaneously as specified on specified days

criteria.textblock: The maximum duration of participation is approximately 9 months. Patients will complete a screening period of up to 21 days. Following screening, eligible patients will be randomly assigned to 1 of 3 treatment sequences. Each patient will undergo 2 14-week treatment periods for a total of 28 weeks (Treatment Period 1 and Treatment Period 2). After completing the 2 treatment periods, patients will enter a 1-month follow-up period.

facility.name: Allergy Treatment Center of New Jersey
Hospital Universitari i Politecnic La Fe de Valencia

patient_data.ipd_description: Shire provides access to the de-identified individual participant data for eligible studies to aid qualified researchers in addressing legitimate scientific objectives. These IPDs will be provided following approval of a data sharing request, and under the terms of a data sharing agreement.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: IPD from eligible studies will be shared with qualified researchers according to the criteria and process described in the Data Sharing section of the www.shiretrials.com website. For approved requests, the researchers will be provided access to anonymized data (to respect patient privacy in line with applicable laws and regulations) and with information necessary to address the research objectives under the terms of a data sharing agreement.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This was a multicenter study conducted at 33 sites/centers in 7 countries: United States, Canada , Germany, Hungary, Israel, Spain, and Romania .
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 81 participants screened, 6 subjects failed to meet the randomization criteria and were not randomly assigned to a treatment sequence . All 75 randomly assigned participants received at least 1 dose of the IP.

group.title: Experimental/Placebo
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive C1 Esterase Inhibitor in the 1st treatment period and then switched to Placebo in the 2nd treatment period.

group.title: Placebo/Experimental
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive placebo treatment in the 1st treatment period and then switched to receive C1 Esterase Inhibitor in the 2nd treatment period.

group.title: Experimental/ Experimental
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive C1 Esterase Inhibitor in both 1st as well as the 2nd treatment period.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Time-Normalized Number of Attacks (NNA) for Participants During a Treatment Period
outcome.description: The angioedema attacks were recorded in the electronic patient diary. The investigator completed a separate angioedema eCRF for each attack based on the review of the patients diary. Time-normalized number of angioedema attacks was expressed as the number of attacks per month (ie, 30.4 days) of exposure. NNA=30.4 * (number of attacks during treatment period) / (days of treatment period).
outcome.time_frame: Weeks 1 to 14 for treatment period 1 and 2
outcome.population: Data were not collected for the Experimental/Experimental Arm for this outcome measure and this represents the full analysis set.

group.title: Treatment C1 INH
group.description: Participants who received C1 Esterase Inhibitor (C1 INH) treatment (in period 1 of the Experimental/Placebo arm and in period 2 of the Placebo/Experimental arm).

group.title: Treatment Placebo
group.description: Participants who received Placebo treatment (in period 2 of the Experimental/Placebo arm and in period 1 of the Placebo/Experimental arm).

measure.title: Time-Normalized Number of Attacks (NNA) for Participants During a Treatment Period
measure.description: The angioedema attacks were recorded in the electronic patient diary. The investigator completed a separate angioedema eCRF for each attack based on the review of the patients diary. Time-normalized number of angioedema attacks was expressed as the number of attacks per month (ie, 30.4 days) of exposure. NNA=30.4 * (number of attacks during treatment period) / (days of treatment period).
measure.population: Data were not collected for the Experimental/Experimental Arm for this outcome measure and this represents the full analysis set.

analysis.groups_desc: The LS means, 95% CIs, and p-values were based on a mixed effect linear model with period, sequence ,use of prophylactic therapy with C1 INH at randomization, and treatment as fixed effects and subject nested within sequence as a random effect.

outcome.title: Proportion of Participants Meeting at Least a 50% Reduction in NNA (Normalized Number of Angioedema Attacks) During the Experimental Injection Treatment Period Relative to the Placebo Period.
outcome.description: The angioedema attacks were recorded in the electronic patient diary. The investigator completed a separate angioedema eCRF for each attack based on the review of the patients diary. Time-Normalized Number of Attacks was expressed as the number of attacks per month (ie, 30.4 days) of exposure. NNA = 30.4 x (number of attacks during treatment period) / (days of treatment period).
outcome.time_frame: Weeks 1 to 14 for treatment period 1 and 2
outcome.population: Analysis done on participants from the crossover sequences (Experimental/Placebo, Placebo/Experimental) who were dosed in both treatment periods. As the measure is implicitly a within subject comparison of the two arms the full analysis set is reported here. Participants with 0 attacks in the placebo period were excluded as %-reduct. not calculated

group.title: Full Analysis Set
group.description: Including all participants in the cross-over sequences who had data in both treatment periods and who received at least one dose of C1 Esterase Inhibitor and had at least 1 post-baseline primary efficacy assessment.

measure.title: Proportion of Participants Meeting at Least a 50% Reduction in NNA (Normalized Number of Angioedema Attacks) During the Experimental Injection Treatment Period Relative to the Placebo Period.

Time-Normalized Number of Attacks was expressed as the number of attacks per month (ie, 30.4 days) of exposure. NNA = 30.4 x (number of attacks during treatment period) / (days of treatment period).
outcome.time_frame: Weeks 1 to 14 for treatment period 1 and 2
outcome.population: Full analysis set from the crossover sequences (Experimental/Placebo arm and Placebo/Experimental arm) was used for analysis of this outcome measure.Participants with zero attacks in the placebo period were excluded because a percent reduction could not be calculated. Analysis was done on participants with pretreatment and post-treatment NNA values

outcome.title: Cumulative Attack Severity
outcome.description: Severity of the angioedema attack sign/symptom was characterized as None: no symptom; Mild: noticeable symptom but easily tolerated by the participant and did not interfere with routine activities; Moderate: symptom interfered with the participant's ability to attend school or participate in family life and social/recreational activities; Severe: symptom significantly limited the participant's ability to attend school or participate in family life and social/recreational activities. Symptom severity score was assigned as Mild = 1, Moderate = 2 and Severe = 3. Cumulative attack severity score was the sum of the maximum symptom severity scores recorded for each angioedema attack in a treatment period. Cumulative attack-severity score normalized per month [(raw score/number of days of participation in that treatment period)*30.4] was reported here. Cumulative attack-severity score normalized per month ranged from 0 to 19.83 and higher scores represent worse symptoms.
outcome.time_frame: Weeks 1 to 14 for treatment period 1 and 2
outcome.population: Data were not collected for the Experimental/Experimental Arm for this outcome measure and this represents the full analysis set.

group.title: Treatment C1 INH
group.description: Participants who received C1 Esterase Inhibitor (C1 INH) treatment (in period 1 of the Experimental/Placebo arm and in period 2 of the Placebo/Experimental arm).

group.title: Treatment Placebo
group.description: Participants who received Placebo treatment (in period 2 of the Experimental/Placebo arm and in period 1 of the Placebo/Experimental arm).

measure.title: Cumulative Attack Severity
measure.description: Severity of the angioedema attack sign/symptom was characterized as None: no symptom; Mild: noticeable symptom but easily tolerated by the participant and did not interfere with routine activities; Moderate: symptom interfered with the participant's ability to attend school or participate in family life and social/recreational activities; Severe: symptom significantly limited the participant's ability to attend school or participate in family life and social/recreational activities. Symptom severity score was assigned as Mild = 1, Moderate = 2 and Severe = 3. Cumulative attack severity score was the sum of the maximum symptom severity scores recorded for each angioedema attack in a treatment period. Cumulative attack-severity score normalized per month [(raw score/number of days of participation in that treatment period)*30.4] was reported here. Cumulative attack-severity score normalized per month ranged from 0 to 19.83 and higher scores represent worse symptoms.
measure.population: Data were not collected for the Experimental/Experimental Arm for this outcome measure and this represents the full analysis set.

analysis.groups_desc: The LS means, 95% CIs, and p-values were based on a mixed effect linear model with period, sequence ,use of prophylactic therapy with C1 INH at randomization, and treatment as fixed effects and subject nested within sequence as a random effect.

outcome.title: PK Parameters: AUC (0-96) and AUC (0-t) for Functional C1 INH Binding Activity
outcome.description: AUC(0-96)=area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero to last measurable concentration; AUC(0-t)=area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to the end of the dosing interval tau, where tau is approximately 84 hours (ie, average of every 3 or 4 days) AUC(0-96) = AUC(0-tau).
outcome.time_frame: Within 15 min prior dosing at week 1, week 2, week 8, week 16, week 24, week 27/28 and 48 (± 3) hours after dose in week 27/28 in period 1 and 2. In addition 24 (±3) hours, 72 (±6) hours and 96 (±6) hours post dose in week 28 for period 2.
outcome.population: All participants included who have taken at least one dose of investigational product and for whom the primary PK data are considered sufficient and interpretable.

group.title: Treatment Placebo
group.description: Participants who received Placebo treatment (in period 2 of the Experimental/Placebo arm and in period 1 of the Placebo/Experimental arm).

measure.population: All participants included who have taken at least one dose of investigational product and for whom the primary PK data are considered sufficient and interpretable.

outcome.title: Assess Disease Activity as Measured by the Angioedema Activity Score (AAS) Normalized Per Month
outcome.description: Disease activity was measured using a 98-day Angioedema Activity Score (AAS). The AAS collects information of disease activity in the last 24 hours. The following items are assessed: experience of swelling, severity of the swelling, timing of the swelling, extent of discomfort due to the swelling, extent that the swelling caused limitations in daily life, and feelings of being disfigured by the swelling. The instrument uses a binary response option for the first item and a three-point response scale for the 5 items thereafter. The daily AAS was the sum of the AAS items per day. Total daily ASS scores range between 0 and 15 points. Higher values stand for higher disease activity. The normalized 98-day AAS per month for a participant is calculated by (the sum of daily AAS within a treatment period/the number of days that a subject has AAS records within the treatment period)*30.4.
outcome.time_frame: Weeks 1 to 14 for treatment period 1 and 2
outcome.population: Data were not collected for the Experimental/Experimental Arm for this outcome measure and this represents the full analysis set.

group.description: Participants who received C1 Esterase Inhibitor (C1 INH) treatment (in period 1 of the Experimental/Placebo arm and in period 2 of the Placebo/Experimental arm).

group.title: Treatment Placebo
group.description: Participants who received Placebo treatment (in period 2 of the Experimental/Placebo arm and in period 1 of the Placebo/Experimental arm).

measure.title: Assess Disease Activity as Measured by the Angioedema Activity Score (AAS) Normalized Per Month
measure.description: Disease activity was measured using a 98-day Angioedema Activity Score (AAS). The AAS collects information of disease activity in the last 24 hours. The following items are assessed: experience of swelling, severity of the swelling, timing of the swelling, extent of discomfort due to the swelling, extent that the swelling caused limitations in daily life, and feelings of being disfigured by the swelling. The instrument uses a binary response option for the first item and a three-point response scale for the 5 items thereafter. The daily AAS was the sum of the AAS items per day. Total daily ASS scores range between 0 and 15 points. Higher values stand for higher disease activity. The normalized 98-day AAS per month for a participant is calculated by (the sum of daily AAS within a treatment period/the number of days that a subject has AAS records within the treatment period)*30.4.
measure.population: Data were not collected for the Experimental/Experimental Arm for this outcome measure and this represents the full analysis set.

analysis.groups_desc: The Least Square means, 95% confidence intervals and p-values are based on mixed effect linear model with period, sequence, use of prophylactic therapy with C1 INH at randomization and treatment as fixed effects and subject nested within sequence as a random effect.

outcome.title: Participant Experience With Self-administration: Overall Experience With the Syringe
outcome.description: Self-administration survey with questions about the overall experience with the syringe was assessed in week 14 (visit 28 and 28b). Visit 28 summarizes treatment period 1 of the experimental/experimental arm and treatment periods 1 and 2 of the experimental/placebo arm and the placebo/experimental arm. Visit 28b summarizes treatment period 2 of the experimental/experimental arm.
outcome.time_frame: Week 14 for treatment period 1 and 2
outcome.population: Visit 28b summarizes only treatment period 2 of the Experimental/Experimental arm. Therefore no participants were analyzed in the placebo group.

Visit 28: Preference for admin - not very strong
Visit 28b: SC better long term option
Visit 28b: IV better long term option
Visit 28b: Preference for admin - very strong
Visit 28b: Preference for admin - fairly strong
Visit 28b: Preference for admin - not very strong

outcome.title: Mean Change in Angioedema Quality of Life Questionnaire Scores From Baseline to Week 13
outcome.description: The AE-QoL is a questionnaire on the quality of life of patients suffering from recurrent angioedema. It consists of 17 specific questions that are associated with work, physical activity, free time, social relations, and food. Each of the 17 questions has a five-point response scale ranging from 1 (Never) to 5 (Very Often). The AE-QoL consists of 4 dimensions (functioning=4 questions(qns) fatigue/mood=5 qns, fears/shame=6 qns, nutrition=2 qns) and a total score (all 17 questions).All scores were calculated by using the following formula: (Σ items - min Σ items / max Σ items - min Σ items) x 100. Σ items=sum of response by participant, min Σ items=minimum response possible, max Σ items=maximum response possible. Scores range from 0 to 100 , with higher scores indicating greater impairment. Absolute change calculated as visit score at week 13 minus score at baseline per period.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to week 13 for treatment period 1 and 2

group.title: Experimental/Placebo Arm - Treatment C1 INH
group.description: Participants randomized to the Experimental/Placebo arm received C1 Esterase Inhibitor (C1 INH) in treatment period 1.

group.title: Experimental/Placebo Arm - Treatment Placebo
group.description: Participants randomized to the Experimental/Placebo arm received Placebo in treatment period 2.

group.title: Placebo/Experimental Arm - Treatment Placebo
group.description: Participants randomized to the Placebo/Experimental arm received Placebo in treatment period 1.

group.title: Placebo/Experimental Arm - Treatment C1 INH
group.description: Participants randomized to the Placebo/Experimental arm received C1 Esterase Inhibitor (C1 INH) in treatment period 2.

group.title: Experimental/Experimental Arm - Period 1 Treatment C1 INH
group.description: Participants randomized to the Experimental/Experimental arm received C1 Esterase Inhibitor (C1 INH) in treatment period 1.

group.title: Experimental/Experimental Arm - Period 2 Treatment C1 INH
group.description: Participants randomized to the Experimental/Experimental arm received C1 Esterase Inhibitor (C1 INH) in treatment period 2.

measure.title: Mean Change in Angioedema Quality of Life Questionnaire Scores From Baseline to Week 13
measure.description: The AE-QoL is a questionnaire on the quality of life of patients suffering from recurrent angioedema. It consists of 17 specific questions that are associated with work, physical activity, free time, social relations, and food. Each of the 17 questions has a five-point response scale ranging from 1 (Never) to 5 (Very Often). The AE-QoL consists of 4 dimensions (functioning=4 questions(qns) fatigue/mood=5 qns, fears/shame=6 qns, nutrition=2 qns) and a total score (all 17 questions).All scores were calculated by using the following formula: (Σ items - min Σ items / max Σ items - min Σ items) x 100. Σ items=sum of response by participant, min Σ items=minimum response possible, max Σ items=maximum response possible. Scores range from 0 to 100 , with higher scores indicating greater impairment. Absolute change calculated as visit score at week 13 minus score at baseline per period.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were reported from the time the informed consent was signed through 7 days afer the last dose of investigational product was received (week 1 to 15 for treatment period 1 and 2).

group.title: Treatment C1 INH
group.description: Participants who received C1 Esterase Inhibitor (C1 INH) treatment (in period 1 of the Experimental/Placebo arm, in period 2 of the Placebo/Experimental arm and in period 1 and 2 of the Experimental/Experimental arm).

group.title: Treatment Placebo
group.description: Participants who received Placebo treatment (in period 2 of the Experimental/Placebo arm and in period 1 of the Placebo/Experimental arm).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If a multicenter publication is not submitted within twelve (12) months after conclusion, abandonment or termination of the Study at all sites, or after Sponsor confirms there shall be no multicenter Study publication, the Institution and/or such Principal Investigator may publish the results from the Institution site individually.
